column1: House Dems blocked relief 40+ times. Dems hold the American people hostage until they get crazy Green New Deal proposals & unrelated election overhaul proposals.   Not gonna happen. @HouseGOP is committed to COVID relief not playing politics. https://t.co/3SLbHo8lSZ

The Trump Admin keeps supporting #NC in COVID-19 response efforts—I’ve seen firsthand. Relief to North Carolinians includes: ➡️$92M to agribusiness; ➡️$244.4M to low-income families; and ➡️378.3M to higher education.
I’ll be on @newsmax with @seanspicer @LyndsayMKeith talking about the President’s #COVID19 diagnosis and the state of #NC election laws at ~6:25 PM EST. Tune in here: https://t.co/MXHCPVMgH1

Thanks @realDonaldTrump & @SecretarySonny for prioritizing food access for vulnerable Americans during #COVID19. @USDA’s Farmers to Families has ✅Supported agribusiness by purchasing $1.78 billion in produce ✅Delivered >56 million boxes of food to families in need ✅Saved jobs https://t.co/jgNV9bQsbG
Tune in tonight at 7PM as I join Jarrod Lowery to talk about federal recognition for the Lumbee coronavirus relief & more 👇 https://t.co/kvAxMC1Jv5
I'll be on WAYN Radio at 10am talking about USPS COVID-19 aid and schools reopening. Tune in here https://t.co/Q4prHle8VC
Thanks to Glenmark Pharmaceuticals for hosting me in Monroe—happy to see all that you’re doing to promote treatments and vaccines for #coronavirus https://t.co/GyB00mwmwR
Ask Me Anything: I’m holding a Tele-Town Hall tomorrow at 1:30PM to answer YOUR questions on #coronavirus.  I want to hear from YOU! https://t.co/roWN2jN0Jk
I’m proud of the work that @NCNationalGuard is doing across #NC to fight #coronavirus. Their selfless initiative has made our state safer. #ncproud

$27M contract for #NC #coronavirus study by @wakehealth & @AtriumHealth! Glad @CDC recognized cutting-edge #coronavirus research in #NC. Thanks to @SenThomTillis @SteveScalise @SenatorBerger @SenBillCassidy for working w/ me to advocate for this groundbreaking contract.
#Coronavirus has exposed the need for supply chain security for critical items—we can’t rely on others during a global crisis. #NC can help…

Thank you @realDonaldTrump Administration for your support of #NC’s efforts to combat coronavirus. #NC has received…  •2.4 million N-95 masks •14.6 million surgical & procedural masks •>459000 eye & face shields •Millions of medical gowns & gloves
Thx @SecGeneScalia for his commitment to keeping workers safe as we reopen. Great to join you @Lowes which continues to support #coronavirus recovery in NC. #NCpol https://t.co/PXFjT6tZrf
Healthcare prof. work day in & day out to fight #coronavirus. Thx @mountaire_farms for donating chicken for Scotland Co.’s healthcare workers! https://t.co/f1bTS39WF6 https://t.co/ad7KQBZ9uz
Thank you @realDonaldTrump & @FEMA for the 35300 swabs & 54500 media tubes heading to #NC! Appreciate the commitment to our state’s #coronavirus testing.

State-issued CON laws stop hospitals from expanding. That is the LAST thing hospitals need as they combat coronavirus. See my conversation with @Protectaxpayers on my bill to suspend CON laws. 👇 https://t.co/rjC2FuAV2H

#America is the most tested country in the world for #coronavirus.  @realdonaldtrump & his administration’s leadership have cut red tape & leaned on strong private companies to reach this monumental achievement! PROUD. https://t.co/99RANKOInD
For national & local updates on #coronavirus visit to https://t.co/7Pqo4FWgbe. Stay informed & stay safe.
I’m answering YOUR questions today on #coronavirus in a teletownhall! Click here to hear it live at 3:10 PM - https://t.co/pyNYes9rpq

We cannot sit idly by & let our first amendment principles erode. I’ll be exercising these rights w/ advocates to #ReopenNC Tuesday @ 11AM in Raleigh while maintaining #socialdistance    See my statement below 👇   https://t.co/RoKqUzGWyd
I’ll be answering your #coronavirus questions on @WBTV_News tomorrow night! Email askus@wbtv.com to submit your question on #PPP loans COVID-19 response & what Congress is doing to help.

I had a great afternoon with @jbnoble at Smoke filling trays for folks who need it and @thekingskitchen sharing them. Jimmy is a marvelous restauranteur even better pastor. Thanks Caroline Winchester for inviting me. Let’s look out for each other amid #coronavirus. https://t.co/Wt5x8RGKip

The NC General Assembly has provided $100000 towards 1000 at home antibody kits after groundbreaking research from @wakehealth. These kits are beginning distribution today & will be integral in providing information needed to combat #coronavirus.

Thanks Association for Advanced Life Underwriting for speaking w/ me about life insurance & its contributions to the financial resilience & longevity American families & businesses. Thank you for your time & adapting during #coronavirus.

For advice & updates to stay safe & stop the spread of #coronavirus visit https://t.co/du76QYW5V6. For any other questions email dan.bishop@mail.house.gov or call (202) 225-1976. My office is here to help!
Thanks @FEMA for helping to shelter vulnerable homeless during #coronavirus pandemic in #NC https://t.co/M1jPmqRor0
Know someone who has acted heroically during the #coronavirus pandemic? Reach out on our website to highlight your hero! https://t.co/daRDmlOIxz https://t.co/wH5zj5SQSD
If you’re healthy- YOU can help! We need ALL hands on deck to combat #coronavirus. See below to find out how you can help & spread the word! https://t.co/gApT4tlmBy

These next 2 weeks will be trying as the virus peaks. But Americans will unite in the face of adversity & come out stronger than before. For more information on #coronavirus visit wwwhttps://t.co/du76QYW5V6
REMINDER tax day has been moved to JULY 15th to allow people to focus on their health & family during the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/Agn2bN3rpJ

Has your church been impacted by Coronavirus? They are eligible for the #PaycheckProtectionProgram—forgivable loans to help make payroll and keep employees. Do you need to file a 990? No - check the 501(c)(3) nonprofit box in the top left corner of the SBA application form 2483!

PSA: Gov. Cooper announced that utility shut offs & late fees for electricity gas water & wastewater payments are halted & there’s an extra 6 months to pay bills w/o interest in #NC. Helps thousands who are at home flattening the curve as we #socialdistance

🚨 CARES Act funded Community Planning & Development grants for Mecklenburg Union & Cumberland counties! Proud to have supported this bill in Congress—great news for #nc09 and #smallbusiness suffering because of #coronavirus.   https://t.co/TZZBzQJruB
Another private stepping up to help combat #coronavirus! Burlington Fabrics in Rockingham is using their resources to make masks. We need all hands on deck! https://t.co/diHbHu5QYS

👏@BlueCrossNC has waived ALL out-of-pocket costs for members and state workers for in & out of network hospitals who have #COVID19! Thank you for your commitment to ensuring #coronavirus patients are worried about their health—not healthcare costs.    https://t.co/9riy0ycCi5

Thanks @NTU for including my critical Increasing Hospital Capacity to Fight Coronavirus Act in their proposed “Phase 4” stimulus package. We must ensure that we equip those on the frontlines of the #coronavirus battle to care for ALL inflicted. https://t.co/3bOaaHR9Li

👏Thank you @NASCAR for using your vast resources & facilities to produce essential #PPE to keep medical workers safe. Private industry stepping up as we work together to combat #coronavirus!  https://t.co/vlV8BpgA58

🚨If you are an able retired medical professional your community needs you! #Coronavirus causes record admittances & we need all hands on deck to save lives. We all have a role to play. How can you contribute? Check here to see how you can volunteer. 👇 https://t.co/r9LVICRHuB https://t.co/f0X3TGfozk

Want to know how #CARESAct affects you?  Curious about NC #StayatHome order? Want the latest from the White House?  For updates about coronavirus & all that’s going on in DC NC and #NC09 sign up for my newsletter at  https://t.co/7Pqo4FWgbe

Drove to DC last week to ensure the #CARESAct passed & so glad it did. The bill gives $100 billion in new funding for hospitals and health care providers—desperately needed during #coronavirus. https://t.co/AFh8yfoIXp
Americans are resilient when faced with immense challenges and I believe #coronavirus is no different.🇺🇸👇 https://t.co/2agWyBsTZU

Proud to support the CARES Act today. It’s a big bill but Congress is mobilizing our economy & enabling frontline operators the supplies & support necessary to fight #coronavirus https://t.co/FCWYWX5h1b
Your friend’s sister’s cousin’s girlfriend who works at DOD is not a great source of #coronavirus info. Trust ONLY official sources and stop the rumor spread! https://t.co/kebqDtA3iO

In uncertain times @NCNationalGuard are resilient dedicated and steadfast patriots. They’re using their resources to transport COVID-19 supplies working Family Support hotline & preparing to do more as the crisis worsens. #NC cannot thank you enough!
When others cannot serve @NCNationalGuard steps up. Brave guardsmen and women are on the frontlines during our Nation’s worst events & the #coronavirus pandemic is no different.
Thank you @RSI for your support! It is critical that we enable hospitals to expand & innovate during the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/n6l22upmUI
We’ve got to DO OUR PART to #SlowtheSpread of #coronavirus. #socialdistancing #flattenthecurve https://t.co/ta46FVyfr2
W/ #coronavirus response we can’t let our small businesses become collateral. At their most vulnerable they don’t need additional burdens/mandates. https://t.co/yCDA2OBTQ6

Thinking about dedicated @TSA agents who remain on the frontlines keeping our Nation safe despite #coronavirus. Thanks to @TSA_Pekoske for speaking to @HouseHomeland yesterday about protecting those who protect us all.

🚨 @HHSgov announced almost $3 million in aid to #NC healthcare centers. This will benefit Anson Robeson & counties across #nc09 & provide critical resources for #coronavirus response. https://t.co/LuEoycBYd5
Reminder: Tax Day is moved to JULY 15!  This gives families more time as they deal with #coronavirus. https://t.co/iMPZ4PrCrh
🚨Student Loans👇👇👇  @USedGov is temporarily WAIVING ALL INTEREST on federally held #studentloans to help during #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/Refy4NTTaJ

Around the globe we’ve seen the importance of operational control of borders in slowing the spread of #coronavirus. I’m proud that @DHSgov continues to #BuildtheWall so we can track who enters our country—now more than ever.   Thank you for your tireless work to keep us safe!

Golden Leaf has helped #NC small biz for over 30 yrs. Proud to see them launch $15M in loans to help businesses deal with #coronavirus #covid19. Thanks @NCgoldenLEAF for looking out for OUR community! https://t.co/SRtR0fTNKi https://t.co/4SNQS8QfPb
Thank you @Lowes for investing in our community and helping North Carolinians respond to #coronavirus!   Businesses are stepping up!   https://t.co/BOFeqiywJ7

In Mecklenburg county 48.8 % of #coronavirus cases are aged 20-39 (from @BoThompsonWBT). Everyone should exercise caution and common-sense social distancing. Young are not immune! https://t.co/AMHizG0FKT

There isn't a day to wait--the American people need immediate help. Urging consensus on a phase 3 relief package that helps workers small businesses and families.  Democrats: stop toying with the American economy and American LIVES. #coronavirus https://t.co/CrSkoVooMZ

I applaud millennials who are diligently #socialdistancing to stop the spread of #coronavirus. Keep it up- but please take extra precautions to stay healthy. Not just older folks health on the line but yours as well. Stay safe.  https://t.co/XaawTErvWR

Proud to urge House leadership to address URGENT cash flow needs of #smallbusiness in the next #covid-19 package w/ @RepRichHudson & @GKButterfield. As a member of @housesmallbiz I will work tirelessly to ensure small businesses in #NC09 stay afloat during this pandemic.

The outbreak of #coronavirus has not pressed the pause button on other health crises. This epidemic has dangerously decreased the amount of blood available for those in need. Find out below if you meet the requirements to donate blood today- WE NEED YOU! https://t.co/3Ad5ECYNZz

Finally when you are in your home be sure to be cautious of those who are most susceptible to #coronavirus and have ONE family member take care anyone feeling sick. See below for more! 👇👇👇 https://t.co/c7bDT0W5Y0

#Coronavirus spreads quick! If you are healthy follow some quick tips to remain strong. Keep windows open in transportation use online methods of shopping if possible & opt for “tap & pay”. See below for more 👇👇 https://t.co/Qq6stApQP9

#Coronavirus contracts through contact! If you or your child is actively in school avoid large crowds between classes study from home & stay in if you are feeling sick! See below for more! 👇👇 https://t.co/TAaFQul9Fy

#Coronavirus spreads quick- so stay safe! If you are actively in the workplace practice good hygiene be careful with food & stay home if you or a loved one is sick! See below for more! 👇👇 https://t.co/WUUpov2jTe

Slowing the spread of #coronavirus is our top priority here in Washington. It is important that you maintain your health—not just for you but for those around you. Here are some quick tips to stop the spread. We must ALL do our part.

Europe Travel Restrictions Fast Facts:   ➡️ Applies to foreign nationals who visited certain European countries in past 14 days ➡️ Americans/legal residents (& most fam members) CAN RETURN but face screening & possible quarantine ➡️ Aim is to slow #COVID19 spread 1/
Proud to vote for emergency funding last week including $13.8M for #NC to prepare for #COVID19! Don’t panic be prepared. 👇👇 @HHSGov    https://t.co/icGWOeuQpX

Last week I supported the #coronavirus funding package including provisions for @SBAgov to provide disaster assistance loans for small biz impacted by #coronavirus. Happy to attend the @HSBCgop hearing to discuss the challenges small businesses face during this uncertain time.

Early in COVID-19 outbreak @realdonaldtrump stopped entry of infected foreigners buying ESSENTIAL time for health officials to prep. Dems want to limit this authority w/ ridiculous #NoBanAct. I’ll vote NO to keep Americans SAFE in emergencies. Thx @HomelandKen ! https://t.co/vgHy6P4Cvo

WEEKLY WRAP: We’re taking #COVID19 AKA #coronavirus seriously in DC. This week I questioned experts heard from @dhs_wolf and @VP and helped pass $8.3B in funding to keep you & your families safe. Headed back to #NC09. https://t.co/smQa6QALtL

I voted yesterday to appropriate $8.3B to contain respond to and treat #coronavirus. Despite some concern for the amount my support is warranted by the need for timely action & my confidence in the Administration to manage the funds. 👇https://t.co/vJ5ocMjUGM
